thread.title_full: Georgia Coach Praises Gonzaga's Ryan Nembhard as Elite Passer

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Georgia Coach Praises Gonzaga's Ryan Nembhard as Elite Passer
text:
Georgia Coach Praises Gonzagaâ€™s Ryan Nembhard as Elite Passer
The Georgia Bulldogs coach Mike White praises Gonzaga's Ryan Nembhard, calling him the "surgeon of a passer." White has known the Nembhard family for years, having coached Ryan's brother, Andrew, during his tenure at Florida. As both teams prepare for their March Madness matchup, White highlights Nembhard's intelligence and toughness, noting he excels at making teammates better. Nembhard led the NCAA with an average of 9.8 assists and scored 10.8 points per game this season, showcasing his significance to Gonzaga's performance.
- Ryan Nembhard averages 9.8 assists per game, leading the NCAA.
- He also averages 10.8 points per game this season.
While Nembhard's skills are widely praised, there are concerns about Gonzaga's inconsistent performance leading into the tournament despite their West Coast Conference title.
State of Play- Georgia is a 9th seed, while Gonzaga is an 8th seed in the March Madness tournament.
- Gonzaga is making its 26th consecutive tournament appearance.
In the upcoming game, if Nembhard continues to perform at his high level, he could play a pivotal role in Gonzaga's advance in the tournament, potentially challenging higher-seeded teams.
Bottom LineRyan Nembhard's vision and passing prowess make him a critical asset for Gonzaga as they embark on their March Madness journey. His ability to elevate teammates could be a deciding factor in their success.
